availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew Mullins (Pendleton County, Kentucky, circuit & county clerk, capt 18th KY Inf USA, lieut col 40th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, court clerk and soldier. Grassy Kentucky native. Married to Ann McGill Mullins in Pendleton County on September 27, 1852. Father of Mary J. Mullins, Sallie K. Mullins, and Kate Mullins. Clerk of the Pendleton County Court in 1855. Clerk of the Pendleton Circuit Court from c1855 to 1860. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from February 8, 1862. Wounded and taken prisoner on August 30, 1862, during the Battle of Richmond, Kentucky, and released on September 7, 1862. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from June 15, 1863, to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton, Falmouth, p. 429.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1799-1948, Film #000272800, p. 59, p. 601 of 660 of microfilm.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1855,” in 1856 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges, State Printer, 1856), 355-357.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859,” in 1860 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 291.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1860,” in 1861 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1861), 357.
